info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 10:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT LAURENS...SOUTHEASTERN GREENVILLE... SOUTHEASTERN SPARTANBURG...EAST CENTRAL ANDERSON...NORTHEASTERN ABBEVILLE...UNION AND NORTHWESTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES UNTIL 1100 PM EDT... At 1001 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Union to 14 miles east of Laurens to 16 miles north of Abbeville, and moving northwest at 5 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Laurens, Union, Anderson, Clinton, Fountain Inn, Belton, Woodruff, Honea Path, Pacolet and Ware Shoals. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions will cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
